title: UC unveils new basketball uniforms
text:
UC unveils new basketball uniforms Tom Groeschen , tgroeschen@enquirer.com 4:40 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 (From left:) UC seniors Octavius Ellis, Farad Cobb, Coreontae DeBerry and Shaq Thomas model the Bearcats' new Under Armour uniforms. (Photo: Provided/GoBearcats.com) 
The University of Cincinnati on Friday revealed its new Under Armour men's basketball uniforms for the 2015-16 season. 
From the UC sports communications department: 
The uniforms made of ArmourVent™ technology feature a red and black proprietary stripe around the waistband and lower part of the shorts and back of the jersey collar. The stripe, created by Under Armour, highlights elements unique to UC and its beautiful campus. The angles represented were inspired by the angles on numerous campus buildings and structures. The white triangles are representative of the windows of the Richard E. Lindner Center located next to Fifth Third Arena and home to the UC Department of Athletics. 
Under Armour became the official outfitter for UC’s intercollegiate athletics program on July 1, 2015. As part of the multi-year agreement, Under Armour is exclusively designing and supplying the footwear, apparel and equipment for training and gameday uniforms for each of UC's 19 men's and women's varsity athletic teams starting with the 2015-16 academic year.Some of the other college basketball programs outfitted by Under Armour include Maryland, Utah, Notre Dame, Stephen F. Austin, Manhattan and St. John’s as well as American Athletic Conference rivals Temple and USF. 
UC began preseason practice last week. Some dates of note: 
Oct. 24 – The Red and Black Scrimmage presented by Skyline Chili - Takes place inside Fifth Third Arena from 1 to 1:45 p.m. The free event gives fans their first look at the Bearcats basketball squad. Fans are encouraged to enter Fifth Third Arena on the east concourse level (near the Bearcat statue). The west concourse entrance will not be available for use. Doors open at 12:30 p.m. Oct. 27 – American Athletic Conference Men’s Basketball Media Day in Orlando, Florida Nov. 3 – Exhibition Game 1: Grand Valley State vs. Cincinnati Fifth Third Arena; 7 p.m.; BEARCATS TV Nov. 7 – Exhibition Game 2: Bellarmine vs. Cincinnati Fifth Third Arena; Time-TBA; BEARCATS TV Nov. 13 – Season Opener: Western Carolina vs. Cincinnati Fifth Third Arena; 2 p.m.; FOX Sports Ohio/ESPN3
